steps.action: Clone the ace3p-extensions repository, either or .
steps.title: Clone ace3p-extensions repository

steps.expect: modelbuilder to open a directory browser dialog
steps.title: New project

steps.action: In that dialog, navigate to the test directory you created in the setup procedure and create a subdirectory `t3p_cavity-quarter`. Select the new subdirectory and click the `OK`.
steps.expect: modelbuilder to display a "Specify New Project" dialog with the "Workspace Directory" and "Name (Subdirectory)" fields set.
steps.title: New project directory

steps.action: Set the "Simulation Template File" to the ACE3P template that is in the ace3p-extensions repository at `simulation-workflows/ACE3P.sbt`.
steps.title: Simulation template "ACE3P.sbt"

steps.action: Set the "Geometry File" to `data/model/3d/netcdf/pillboxwg.ncdf`. You will need to set the extension dropdown to "netcdf".
steps.title: Geometry model "pillboxwg.ncdf"

steps.expect: modelbuilder to close the dialog, then display the model geometry in the 3D view and update the Attribute Editor to display a "Modules" tab. On some systems, the model is not immediately displayed, but instead it appears when the "Resources" tab is selected. If that occurs, add a comment to the GitLab issue. Verify that there are two items listed in the "Resources" panel, labeled `sbi.default` and `pillboxwg`.
steps.title: Apply

steps.expect: modelbuilder Output Messages to include "Saved Project".
steps.title: Save Project

steps.action: In the Attribute Editor select the "Modules" tab and select "T3P" as the module in the drop down menu.
steps.expect: Six tabs should appear in the attribute editor labeled Boundary Conditions, Materials, Analysis, Beam Info, Loading, and Monitors.
steps.title: Set T3P

steps.action:
In the "Boundary Condition" tab
  1. Set surface 1 and 2 = Magnetic
  2. Set surface 3 and 4 = Absorbing
  3. Set surface 5 and 6 = Exterior
steps.title: Setting Boundary Conditions

steps.action:
In the "Analysis" tab
  1. Change the "Liner Solver" dropdown to "MUMPS"
  2. Set the max time to 5e-09
  3. Set time steps to 2e-12
steps.title: Analysis Settings

steps.action:
In the "Beam Info" tab
  1. Click on the "new" button
  2. Set the name to "BeamLoading"
  3. Set the bunch type to "Gaussian"
  4. Enter 0.01 as the RMS Bunch Legion and 5 as the number of legions
  5. Set the symmetry factor to 4
  6. Set the charge to 1.0e-12
  7. Set the start point to 0, 0, -0.075 respectively
  8. Set the source boundary to surface 3
steps.title: Beam Info Settings

steps.action:
In the "Monitor" tab
  1. Set the drop down menu to "Volume"
  2. Click on the "new" button and click enter
  3. The "Name" box should be blank and red - make the name "mymon"
  4. Set the Start time to 0, End time to 5e-09, and the Interval to 1e-10
In the same tab change the drop down to "Wakefield" click "new" and the enter
  1. The "Name" box should be blank and red - make the name "wakefield"
  2. Set Start contour to -0.075 and End contour to 0.075 with a Max distance of 1.4
In the same tab change the drop down to "Power" click "new" and the enter
  1. The "Name" box should be blank and red - make the name "power-monitor"
  2. Set the monitor boundary to surface 5
In the same tab change the drop down to "Voltage" click "new" and the enter
  1. The "Name" box should be blank and red - make the name "mode-voltage"
  2. Set the monitor port to surface 6
steps.title: Monitor settings

steps.action: Save, export, and verify that the .t3p file has been generated.
steps.title: Saving
